title: Swan brings motorway to a standstill
text:
The swan was moved to a safe location by officers (Picture: @trafficscotland)

A swan has caused lengthy tailbacks on a motorway lasting for two miles.

The bird made its way onto the busy M8 in Glasgow around 5pm this afternoon.

Officers say they have moved it to a side of the lane, after it closed one eastbound lane of the motorway at junction 16.

❗️UPDATE⌚️17:12#M8 E/B at J16 - here's the swan, currently looking quite comfy on grass verge.



Traffic queuing now from Kingston Bridge.@ScotTranserv pic.twitter.com/9IzCtBgARb — Traffic Scotland (@trafficscotland) October 26, 2019

The incident occurred at around 5pm this afternoon on the M8 (Picture: Traffic Scotland)

Traffic Scotland tweeted at the time of the incident: ‘One lane currently closed while Police Scotland attempt to round a swan on the carriageway. Queues are building…’

After moving it, they posted: ‘Here’s the swan, currently looking quite comfy on grass verge.’

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: Vehicles queued for two miles as a result of the disruption.
